Utterances.UttText: Subjective: HPI - Mr.
Gerry Cage is a 46-year-old male with a history of hypertension who presents after an episode of chest pain 3 days ago.

Phrases.PhraseText: a 46-year-old male with a history of hypertension
presents after an episode of chest pain 3 days ago.

Utterances.UttText: The patient reports he was carrying heavy groceries to his car and felt a deep ache in the center of his chest.

Phrases.PhraseText: a deep ache in the center of his chest.

Utterances.UttText: The pain subsided after 5-10 minutes of rest.
During the episode he felt lightheaded and "winded" but the pain did not radiate anywhere.
He says he has also felt "twinges" of pain 2-3 times over the past 4 months, also while exerting himself.

Phrases.PhraseText: of pain 2-3 times over the past 4 months,

Utterances.UttText: Meds - chlorthalidone 25mg daily, lisinopril 10mg daily.
Allergies - none.
PMHx - hypertension diagnosed 5 years ago.

MappingCandidates.CandidatePreferred: Life Expectancy Less than Five Years

Utterances.UttText: FHx - father had MI in 40s, had bypass surgery.
Mother had type 2 DM, HTN, died of PE.
Maternal grandmother died of breast cancer.
SHx - works in IT for Capital One.
Walks dog 0.5 miles daily.
Drinks 2-3 glasses of wine on Fridays and Saturdays.
Smokes 1 pack per day.
Denies illicit drug use.
Objective: Vitals - T98F, HR 85, RR 14, BP 150/52 Physical Exam - Pulmonary -> non-labored breathing, chest with no visible deformities or scarring.
No wheezes, rhonchi, or rales auscultated anteriorly or posteriorly in any lung fields.
Full chest expansion and no accessory muscle use.
Cardiac -> No murmurs, rubs, or gallops.
Regular rate and rhythm.
Good perfusion of extremities.
Assessment: SS - Mr.
Gerry Cage is a 46-year-old male with a history of HTN who presents after an episode of chest pain on exertion.

Phrases.PhraseText: a 46-year-old male with a history of HTN
presents after an episode of chest pain

Utterances.UttText: DDx - Angina is most likely given pain with exertion and family history of cardiac disease.

Phrases.PhraseText: most likely given pain with exertion

Utterances.UttText: Must also consider GERD (patient reports pain after eating large meal sometimes).

Phrases.PhraseText: pain after eating large meal sometimes

Utterances.UttText: Plan: 1.
EKG today.
Also draw CMP and CBC.
Chest x-ray.
